Home.title: Colonial Collections Datahub
Home.description: The Colonial Collections Datahub is a place to explore objects that have their origins in former Dutch colonial countries such as Suriname, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, South Africa, Aruba, Cura√ßao, Sint Maarten and many other countries and areas.
Home.searchPlaceholder: Tip: start searching for a location, e.g. Suriname
Home.communitiesDescription: Every culture can start its own community on this platform. A community can create lists of objects that tells stories about their history. Communities can also add narratives to the objects in this collection.
Home.communitiesLink: Here are some communities to inspire you. Or <link>take a look at all the communities</link>.

Provenance.title: Provenance
Provenance.description: Provenance information shows the trail an object has made before it came at the current location. It can contain information about previous owners to technical processing information. This provenance data is often incomplete.

Filters.aboutFacetsText: The data of these facet items are collected from multiple datasets. We are in the process of improving the quality of these facets items.

WorkInProgress.roadmapLink: Read about the current status and roadmap of this project.

Communities.title: Communities

Community.title: Community of
Community.objectListsSubTitle: This community has {count, plural, =0 {0 lists} =1 {1 list} other {# lists}}
Community.error: Something went wrong while fetching the community. Please try again later.
Community.descriptionAttributionId:
A community needs at least one member with a valid ORCID to comment and add new information to objects in the application. ORCID is primarily intended for researchers and can be created through the <link>ORCID website</link>.

When you link your ORCID to your community, you will be seen as its spokesperson and all comments made by the members are registered using your ORCID. This way the application supports a certain level of anonymity without losing the ability to accredit the source of the added knowledge. Moreover it allows you to grow the community among participants that do not have a formal (western) academical training.
Community.labelLicense: I agree that all added information in the application is published with a <link>CC-BY-4.0 license</link>
Community.communityEditServerError: Something went wrong while updating the community. Please try again later.

Community.descriptionMaxLength: Description has a maximum of 2000 characters
Community.attributionIdInvalidString: ORCID should be a valid url
Community.noAttributionIdWarning: To add narratives or provenance information to objects you need to add an ORCID to your community profile.

UserEnrichmentForm.title: Add a narrative
UserEnrichmentForm.descriptionSubTitle: Here you can add your own narrative to the Description of this object.
UserEnrichmentForm.communitySubTitle: Select the community you speak on behalf of.
UserEnrichmentForm.citationSubTitle: Please provide information that supports your narrative.
UserEnrichmentForm.languageSubTitle: Select a language of the narrative. Start typing to select a language.
UserEnrichmentForm.successfullyAdded: Your narrative has been added to the object. It could take a moment before it is visible.
UserEnrichmentForm.serverError: Something went wrong while creating the narrative. Please try again later.
UserEnrichmentForm.noCommunities: You are not yet a member of a community that has permission to add a story. You can create a community or join an existing community.
